Authors:
Andy Robert Nilsen, Xin Yue Wang, Karl Soop, Jerry A
Cooper, Tina Claire Summerfield, Chris Michael Brown, David Allan
Orlovich
Title: Four new species of Cortinarius purple pouch fungi
Keywords:
Cortinarius, sequestrate, secotioid, purple pouch,
taxonomy, ectomycorrhiza
Abstract:
Cortinarius is a specious ectomycorrhizal genus that
contains taxa that exhibit either agaricoid or sequestrate morphologies.
In New Zealand, one of the most recognisable Cortinarius species is the
purple-pouch fungus, C. porphyroideus. Here we describe four new species
of purple pouch Cortinarius: Cortinarius diaphorus, C. minorisporus, C.
ostradsignatos, C. purpureocapitatus. These new species are associated
with Nothofagus spp. and have very similar morphology to C.
porphyroideus, but are phylogenetically distinct based on the ITS and
LSU region. In addition, based on molecular evidence, Thaxterogaster
viola is synonymised with C. porphyroideus and C. violaceovolvatus is
transferred C. porphyroideus var. violaceovolvatus.
